#summary How to use the model/code coverage tools
#labels Development,Phase-Implementation

=Introduction=

Starting in r701, there has been some experimental support for code coverage from the model.

=Instructions=

  # Execute [http://code.google.com/p/iaml/source/browse/trunk/org.openiaml.model.codegen.oaw/src/org/openiaml/model/codegen/oaw/coverage/RunInstrumentation.java RunInstrumentation] as a Java application; this will add instrumentation data to all the templates
  # Force a refresh of your local workspace (so that the templates can be rebuilt through XPT)
  # Make sure that you have the [http://code.google.com/p/iaml/source/browse/trunk/org.openiaml.model.codegen.oaw/src/org/openiaml/model/codegen/oaw/coverage/OutputInstrumentation.java OutputInstrumentation] instrumenter enabled as part of the IACleanerBeautifier: r903
  # Execute a test case

Generating the instrumentation results:

  # Execute [http://code.google.com/p/iaml/source/browse/trunk/org.openiaml.model.codegen.oaw/src/org/openiaml/model/codegen/oaw/coverage/RevertInstrumentation.java RevertInstrumentation] to remove the instrumentation code from the templates
  # Execute [http://code.google.com/p/iaml/source/browse/trunk/org.openiaml.model.codegen.oaw/src/org/openiaml/model/codegen/oaw/coverage/OutputInstrumentation.java OutputInstrumentation] as a Java application to generate the [http://iaml.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/org.openiaml.model.codegen.oaw/instrument/output/index.html instrumentation results]
  # Note that successive test case executions will append information to the existing instrumentation dumps; you will have to delete `instrument/*.dump` manually otherwise

Once finished:

  # Revert the changes to the IACleanerBeautifier
  # Execute [http://code.google.com/p/iaml/source/browse/trunk/org.openiaml.model.codegen.oaw/src/org/openiaml/model/codegen/oaw/coverage/RevertInstrumentation.java RevertInstrumentation] as a Java application
  # Force a refresh of your local workspace
